title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and examples or to score the response.

Each criterion is achieved independently.
descriptions:
The response does not accomplish the task set by part A of the question.

Part A: Describe one specific contribution made by an African American to scientific or technological advances after 1900.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • George Washington Carver developed methods to conserve soil and ways to make peanut and soybean agriculture more profitable.

  • Katherine Johnson, a NASA mathematician, developed successful calculations for space travel, helping to launch astronauts to the Moon.

  • Physician, engineer, and NASA astronaut Mae Jemison became the first African American woman to travel in space.

  • Kizzmekia Corbett was central to the development of the Moderna COVID-19 mRNA vaccine.

The response accomplishes the task set by part A of the question.

Part A: Describe one specific contribution made by an African American to scientific or technological advances after 1900.

  • Kizzmekia Corbett was central to the development of the Moderna COVID-19 mRNA vaccine.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and examples or to score the response.

Each criterion is achieved independently.
descriptions:
The response does not accomplish the task set by part B of the question.

Part B: Describe one conclusion that can be drawn from the data in the graphs.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • African Americans have been slowly and steadily earning more PhDs since the mid-1990s.

  • African Americans have been more likely to earn a PhD in the humanities, education, or social sciences than in science or engineering.

  • Nearly half the doctoral degrees earned by African Americans are in the field of education.

The response accomplishes the task set by part B of the question.

Part B: Describe one conclusion that can be drawn from the data in the graphs.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • African Americans have been slowly and steadily earning more PhDs since the mid-1990s.

  • African Americans have been more likely to earn a PhD in the humanities, education, or social sciences than in science or engineering.

  • Nearly half the doctoral degrees earned by African Americans are in the field of education.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and examples or to score the response.

Each criterion is achieved independently.
descriptions:
The response does not accomplish the task set by part C of the question.

Part C: Explain how changes in the 1950s and 1960s provide a helpful context for understanding the data in the graphs.

Examples that earn this point include but are not limited to the following:

  • After Brown v. Board of Education, many African Americans were able to get better access to education and were more likely to attend college.

  • In the 1960s, many universities began accepting more African Americans into their undergraduate and graduate programs, and the number of Black college graduates increased.

  • The Black Campus movement of the 1960s encouraged more African Americans to pursue higher education through greater support for Black students, faculty, and administrators.

  • The G.I. Bill provided funds for college tuition to World War II veterans; this helps explain the increase in African American education that is evident in data.

The response accomplishes the task set by part C of the question.
